intro: [WRONG START] Ipomoea setosa var. pavonini, commonly known as the velvet leaf morning glory, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of South America. It features heart-shaped, velvety leaves that are typically dark green with a distinctive waxy texture. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, which bloom in the morning. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
